item.title: How to add gradient animation as site header in ghost blo
item.description: Using Presets Link to heading There is a great tool to start with. Head over to below link and create your gradient config. You can always modify everything later on. https://www.gradient-animator.com/ Add to your site Link to heading If you are using a ghost instance, there are two ways Add to code injection Update the theme css files Code injection Link to heading .css-selector { background: linear-gradient(308deg, #000000, #000000, #f75900, #000000); background-size: 800% 800%; -webkit-animation: z00md 21s ease infinite; -moz-animation: z00md 21s ease infinite; animation: z00md 21s ease infinite; } @-webkit-keyframes z00md { 0%{background-position:0% 14%} 50%{background-position:100% 87%} 100%{background-position:0% 14%} } @-moz-keyframes z00md { 0%{background-position:0% 14%} 50%{background-position:100% 87%} 100%{background-position:0% 14%} } @keyframes z00md { 0%{background-position:0% 14%} 50%{background-position:100% 87%} 100%{background-position:0% 14%} } Inside the site header code injection box, add a new style tag and just paste the above css directly.
